text: Answer: (c) Solution: Let say Block size = 2= bytes #Blocks = 17‘: = ot #Sets = z‘:—;x: 213-x2 #bits for Index = 13 -x-2 #bits for Offset = x So #bits for TAG =16-(13-x-2+x) =16-11 =5 For a 2-way set associative cache, each set contains two blocks (block 0 and block 1). We need one bit per set to identify which of these blocks is the LRU block. Note that if block 0 is the LRU block, then block 1 is the MRU (most recently used) block, and vice versa. If the cache was 4- way set associative, each set needs to record the LRU block, the second-LRU block, .., the MRU block. There are 4! = 24 permutations of 4 blocks, and hence the cache needs L = llog,(41] = 5 LRU bits per set.
